content:
Maybe these issues need some more specific labels so they're on the radar of the people best able to triage or fix them?

  • Apparent bad interaction between panic! and Ruby's rb_raise #40973
  • Cause a debug break when a panic occurs on Windows. #34502

Though I'm uncertain what additional labels should be used, if any. But they've been sitting open awhile and could probably use something to draw attention to them.

those weren't on my radar at least but I've recategorized them both as t-libs (issues of which I've been prioritizing over t-libs-api recently). I'll take a look at those in more detail later and if applicable tag them for external contributors / mentorship
Thanks! At this point I think they need someone to confirm that they're still relevant and if there's a path forward with either of them.
for the question of drawing attention to them, the E-help-wantedis the one I've always found to be most successful at getting issues solved almost immediately
but i've misapplied it in some cases where when someone went to actually submit a PR other team members point out that we didn't actually want that thing that much and have nobody to review it
i dont think that would be the case here
but yea, good call on double checking they're still needed first

Jane Lusby [she/her] said:

for the question of drawing attention to them, the E-help-wantedis the one I've always found to be most successful at getting issues solved almost immediately

also submitting them to this-week-in-rust
